sentences.chinese: 你這個人太狡猾，我實看不透你。

sentences.english: In the story, the cunning fox outsmarts the hunters.
sentences.chinese: 在這個故事中，狡猾的狐狸智取了獵人們。

sentences.english: Thereal Chinaman may be cunning, but there is no malignity in his cunning.
sentences.chinese: 真正的中國人也許狡猾，但狡猾中並無陰險。

sentences.english: Thereal Chinaman may be cunning, but there is no malignity in his cunning.
sentences.chinese: 真正的中國人也許狡猾，但狡猾中並無陰險。

sentences.english: She is just another double-dealing lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她只是另一個狡猾可惡的律師。

sentences.english: When you say that I murdered him treacherously and foully , you lie.
sentences.chinese: 你說我狡猾而骯髒地謀殺了他時，你說的是謊言。

sentences.english: But leave it for a few minutes and then taste it again.
sentences.chinese: 他狡猾地笑道，“但等幾分鐘，再嚐嚐看。”

sentences.english: The red fox's resourcefulness has earned it a legendary reputation for intelligence and cunning.
sentences.chinese: 赤狐的聰明狡猾足智多謀使它譽滿四海。

sentences.english: The tricky street pedlar cheated the girl into giving him all her money.
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的攤販把小姑娘的錢全騙走了。

sentences.english: Children are in some way cunning , they always know how to get what they want.
sentences.chinese: 孩子有時很狡猾，他們總能得到他們想要的。

sentences.english: The poor child was cheated out of his inheritance by a dishonest lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 這個可憐的孩子被一個狡猾的律師騙去了遺產。

sentences.english: The sly fox nimbly eluded the dogs.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狡猾的狐狸靈活地躲避開那羣狗。

sentences.english: Enrico was too good, an old fox, cunning.
sentences.chinese: 恩里科很有心計，是一隻狡猾的老狐狸。

sentences.english: Her father was a wily old attorney.
sentences.chinese: 她父親是一個狡猾的老執法官。

sentences.english: He was preeminently cunning, and could bide his time with a patience that was nothing less than primitive.
sentences.chinese: 他更多的是狡猾，運用天性中的忍耐性等待時機到來。

definition: deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
